ygData.subject: RE: Since this IS a cheat list, here is one I discover ed
ygData.msgSnippet: Nice but not good. Necros still Have pets, plus Lifetap, Plus Root, Plus, Poison shock, plus Cancel magic, hit it once then Darkness him, then hit him with CM
ygData.messageBody:
Nice but not good. Necros still Have pets, plus Lifetap, Plus Root, Plus,
Poison shock, plus Cancel magic, hit it once then Darkness him, then hit him
with CM again and same Nice thing is that he won't cancel his DoT's just
the buffs. This would work against a newbie PvP but not an experienced one.


Xakthan
Lord of Shadows
Follower of the Crimson Knights

<--- Enigma --->
http://members.door.net/enigma

-----Original Message-----
From: Fling, Kirby [mailto:FlingKirby@...]
Sent: Wednesday, July 21, 1999 1:40 PM
To: 'EQCheats@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [EQCheats] Since this IS a cheat list, here is one I discover
ed

From: "Fling, Kirby" <FlingKirby@...>

Oh my! that's the best "cheat" I've read on this list in a long time!!

What a great way to spank those arrogant DE necros that think they own PvP.

Thanks!

-----Original Message-----
Your character can only have a 15 conditions affecting him or her at one
time. If you are going into a battle with something that has a really
nasty condition (like when fighting necros or crits that charm) Get a
Shaman load a bunch of buffs on you. Then you will not be bothered by
the harmful stuff. You can try this yourself. I am a lvl 24 Shaman so
I cast all my buffs and filled all the slots up(5 stat buffs, 5
resistance buffs, 2 sight buffs, my ac/hp buff, my ac only buff and SoW)
Then I cast Envenomed Breath on myself. I didn't get the usual resist
message, but I didn't take damage and I didn't get the poison icon.
